post.body: Re:"my cold" -- Sounds like a good plan. I figured it'd be best not go to #beerandblog tonight and release it as shareware. :)
I've been enjoying #avacado all week. Why wait for Cali? Hass Avacados are always in season: http://is.gd/cEvC
Re:#igniteportland I love the event and am glad I can assist. Thanks to you and all the others for making these possible.
Great job capturing the mysterious Land of Ashes in winter wonderland mode at night -- http://is.gd/ctGV && http://is.gd/ctGU
Product idea: Produce hand-knitted cosies for iPod/iPhone/BB/PDA & notebook screen protectors. #mobilenanoelectricblanket
If #OSEB knitted server cosy #electricblanket can have part shaped like an open box, it'd also serve double-duty as a cat magnet.
Methinks we can quickly ship an alpha #OSEB release: Gentoo server + knitted server cosy == passable #electricblanket
I'm painfully goal-directed, yet many of my most significant realizations came when off on paths I didn't realize were there.
No worries. If it got too cold, my fallback plan was to upgrade my servers to #Gentoo so they'd more effectively heat apartment.
Comrade Lenin's head has been located, along with his burly band of (Potemkin?) Village People: http://is.gd/cs5t
Thanks for looking. I'm glad DokuWiki at least lets me embed raw HTML to bypass the limitations of its markup language.
Hope you and Tara had a great vacation. Have a safe flight home and see you soonish.
Harder to use if you don't know them? Please show me how to link to locally-hosted image w/ DokuWiki's ML: http://is.gd/ewsx
Re:"diagram tool?" - Dia is fairly powerful, and one learns to cope with its slight clunkiness: http://projects.gnome.org/dia/
I firmly believe there's a sinister Howl's Moving Castle styled factory that churns out and abandons markup and iCalendar libraries.
Re:"when did redcloth go super?" -- Not "when", but "why". http://is.gd/eqWj
Re:"I forgot that I'd created a Hiveminder account" -- TODO: Add a "Use to-do list" to-do item to to-do list too. #tonguetwister
Here's a fascinating Ruby Markdown implementation that a Perl programmer would appreciate on many levels: http://is.gd/eqNo
#pdxtst 1 cm of snow. Buses to slide off roads, articulated lorries jackknife, and once sane people to drive like f'ing morons in 3, 2, 1...
#pdxtst brings you the long-awaited feature-presentation of "SNOWPOCALYPSE NOW": http://twitpic.com/su81 http://twitpic.com/su86
#lol Flying Spaghetti Monster holiday lights: http://tinyurl.com/5ocwnf
Dear rdiff-backup: You rock, but why not provide an easier way to delete unwanted files than multiple rm's and editing a .gz metadata file?
#anime Rewatched "Utawarerumono". Great romance & war in complex fight fueled by love, loyalty, greed, race, politics,etc. http://is.gd/bCu4
#pogonology Re:"El Insecto!?" - See it and other beard styles in great photos at http://tinyurl.com/5zefk8
#pogonology @buchino - Fu Manchu crossed with an El Insecto? Noteworthy beard glimpsed at http://is.gd/bzIR
#warnerd Prora to be redeveloped? Site of 5 km-long epic Nazi holiday resort. http://is.gd/bzB0 http://is.gd/bzCc http://is.gd/bzCH
#warnerd Article with photos of the CROWS remote-controlled turret and fire-control console: http://bit.ly/2ku1Hi
#warnerd RC turrets in Iraq: "accuracy of..fire..uncanny speed..due to..guys operating these..grew up playing video games" http://is.gd/bzmP
Obama campaign logos that could have been:http://www.logodesignlove.com/obama-08-logo-design-options #typography #logos #design
twhirl on linux works again with experimental version http://tinyurl.com/5nort3 -- thx @akfarrell
#recommendation The Firefox add-on "Toggle Word Wrap" wraps long lines in PRE tags and text files. http://is.gd/byPC
#rails Radiant CMS: Can talk to it via web, but not much via Rails code. Comatose CMS: can talk to it via code, but not much via web. #ugh
#calagator Delighted by interest from Sweden, Corvallis, and Seattle in running Calagator instances or extending main site for multi-regions
#rails Evaluated Radiant and Comatose plugins, but feel like I have more questions than answers because of their baffling design decisions.
#lol Useful English phrases for students, e.g.,: "You are pretty smart, Tatyana, but unforgivably ugly." http://englishrussia.com/?p=2160
#ignite Have you commented on the Ignite proposals? At bottom of each proposal is a place to leave us a private comment. http://is.gd/bsZP
#ignite Finished making changes to Ignite proposals to make it easier for admins to keep up with comments on proposals.
Back from Beer & Blog after-party. Good sake and a good time was had with @tiesque @natronics @skinny @brampitoyo @chrispitzer @akfarrell
Off to Beer & Blog at The Dragon - http://calagator.org/events/1250456248
Big thanks to Network Redux for providing servers for the upcoming Open Source Bridge Conference #bridgepdx -- http://www.networkredux.com/
#programming Informative story-like article describing my preferred workflow with git and its local history rewriting: http://is.gd/cuIV
Sketched nice stack of diagrams, timelines, tasks & plans in prep for #bridgepdx tech mtg. Came up w/ solution for theming #ignite apps.
#igniteportland proposals app's source code now has solid tests, docs, and easy interactive setup. Exploring ways to add theming support.
Retweeting @StevenWalling: Okay, what smartass made http://snowpocalypse.com/ ? I want to buy you drink @beerandblog tomorrow.
Distinctions between wasted time, play, tinkering, research, overplanning, and being "productive" can be very fuzzy in creative pursuites.
#Calagator mini code sprint, Saturday, December 20, 2008 from noonâ€“4pm, Urban Grind NW - http://is.gd/csor
Retweeting @spinnerin: Alright, #Calagator Outside Portland, the FAQ: http://code.google.com/p/calagator/wiki/CalagatorOutsidePortland
RT @brampitoyo: designing for serendipity: making things with enough fuzziness to allow user to discover connections we may not know
Strategic flan reserves depleted. Wish @pdxflaneur a had fleet of scooters offering a rapid PDX-area flan-to-doorstep micro-delivery service
Uploaded batch of UI wireframes for #BridgePDX conference application to planning wiki: http://is.gd/ewDW
DokuWiki markup for linking locally-hosted image: {{:my_namespace:my_image.png?linkonly|my link title}} -- Thx to @StevenWalling for assist
I love the "It's All Text" Firefox add-on, which lets me edit textareas using an editor of my choice, like vim: http://is.gd/3Ccj
Why are newfangled "simple" wiki markup languages almost always harder to use than raw HTML? #getoffmylawn
Cranking out wireframes for #BridgePDX applications using "Pencil", a simple yet productive wireframe add-on for Firefox: http://is.gd/M9E
Facts: Cafe like NWUG is great for systematic, detailed planning. Bar like Le Happy is great for big picture, philosophical planning.
Back from epic #BridgePDX tech planning session featuring at various times: @akfarrell @reidab @notbenh @spinnerin @selenamarie THANKS!
At UGNW w/ @akfarrell working on Bridge tech stuff. Join us if you've got time and are in neighborhood.
Off to Typhoon on Broadway for lunch. #yum
When names and meanings collide: "Discount is an implementation of the Markdown markup language." #forinternaluseonly
Fun-to-pronounce & amusingly-named markup languages I've used: troff, LaTeX, CREOLE, OWL-S, Haml, Sass, POD, SuperRedCloth, YAML, OGDL.
